00020 int APIENTRY _tWinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance,
00021                      HINSTANCE hPrevInstance,
00022                      LPTSTR    lpCmdLine,
00023                      int       nCmdShow)
00024 {
00025         UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER(hPrevInstance);
00026         UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER(lpCmdLine);
00027 
00028         // TODO: Place code here.
00029         MSG msg;
00030         HACCEL hAccelTable;
00031 
00032         // Initialize global strings
00033         LoadString(hInstance, IDS_APP_TITLE, szTitle, MAX_LOADSTRING);
00034         LoadString(hInstance, IDC_TEST, szWindowClass, MAX_LOADSTRING);
00035         MyRegisterClass(hInstance);
00036 
00037         // Perform application initialization:
00038         if (!InitInstance (hInstance, nCmdShow))
00039         {
00040                 return FALSE;
00041         }
00042 
00043         hAccelTable = LoadAccelerators(hInstance, MAKEINTRESOURCE(IDC_TEST));
00044 
00045         // Main message loop:
00046         while (GetMessage(&msg, NULL, 0, 0))
00047         {
00048                 if (!TranslateAccelerator(msg.hwnd, hAccelTable, &msg))
00049                 {
00050                         TranslateMessage(&msg);
00051                         DispatchMessage(&msg);
00052                 }
00053         }
00054 
00055         return (int) msg.wParam;
00056 }

00060 //
00061 //  FUNCTION: MyRegisterClass()
00062 //
00063 //  PURPOSE: Registers the window class.
00064 //
00065 //  COMMENTS:
00066 //
00067 //    This function and its usage are only necessary if you want this code
00068 //    to be compatible with Win32 systems prior to the 'RegisterClassEx'
00069 //    function that was added to Windows 95. It is important to call this function
00070 //    so that the application will get 'well formed' small icons associated
00071 //    with it.
00072 //
00073 ATOM MyRegisterClass(HINSTANCE hInstance)
00074 {
00075         WNDCLASSEX wcex;
00076 
00077         wcex.cbSize = sizeof(WNDCLASSEX);
00078 
00079         wcex.style                      = CS_HREDRAW | CS_VREDRAW;
00080         wcex.lpfnWndProc        = WndProc;
00081         wcex.cbClsExtra         = 0;
00082         wcex.cbWndExtra         = 0;
00083         wcex.hInstance          = hInstance;
00084         wcex.hIcon                      = LoadIcon(hInstance, MAKEINTRESOURCE(IDI_TEST));
00085         wcex.hCursor            = LoadCursor(NULL, IDC_ARROW);
00086         wcex.hbrBackground      = (HBRUSH)(COLOR_WINDOW+1);
00087         wcex.lpszMenuName       = MAKEINTRESOURCE(IDC_TEST);
00088         wcex.lpszClassName      = szWindowClass;
00089         wcex.hIconSm            = LoadIcon(wcex.hInstance, MAKEINTRESOURCE(IDI_SMALL));
00090 
00091         return RegisterClassEx(&wcex);
00092 }
00093 
00094 //
00095 //   FUNCTION: InitInstance(HINSTANCE, int)
00096 //
00097 //   PURPOSE: Saves instance handle and creates main window
00098 //
00099 //   COMMENTS:
00100 //
00101 //        In this function, we save the instance handle in a global variable and
00102 //        create and display the main program window.
00103 //
00104 BOOL InitInstance(HINSTANCE hInstance, int nCmdShow)
00105 {
00106    HWND hWnd;
00107 
00108    hInst = hInstance; // Store instance handle in our global variable
00109 
00110    hWnd = CreateWindow(szWindowClass, szTitle, WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW,
00111       CW_USEDEFAULT, 0, CW_USEDEFAULT, 0, NULL, NULL, hInstance, NULL);
00112 
00113    if (!hWnd)
00114    {
00115       return FALSE;
00116    }
00117 
00118    ShowWindow(hWnd, nCmdShow);
00119    UpdateWindow(hWnd);
00120 
00121    return TRUE;
00122 }
00123 
00124 //
00125 //  FUNCTION: WndProc(HWND, UINT, WPARAM, LPARAM)
00126 //
00127 //  PURPOSE:  Processes messages for the main window.
00128 //
00129 //  WM_COMMAND  - process the application menu
00130 //  WM_PAINT    - Paint the main window
00131 //  WM_DESTROY  - post a quit message and return
00132 //
00133 //
00134 LRESULT CALLBACK WndProc(HWND hWnd, UINT message, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00135 {
00136         int wmId, wmEvent;
00137         PAINTSTRUCT ps;
00138         HDC hdc;
00139 
00140         switch (message)
00141         {
00142         case WM_COMMAND:
00143                 wmId    = LOWORD(wParam);
00144                 wmEvent = HIWORD(wParam);
00145                 // Parse the menu selections:
00146                 switch (wmId)
00147                 {
00148                 case IDM_ABOUT:
00149                         DialogBox(hInst, MAKEINTRESOURCE(IDD_ABOUTBOX), hWnd, About);
00150                         break;
00151                 case IDM_EXIT:
00152                         DestroyWindow(hWnd);
00153                         break;
00154                 default:
00155                         return DefWindowProc(hWnd, message, wParam, lParam);
00156                 }
00157                 break;
00158         case WM_PAINT:
00159                 hdc = BeginPaint(hWnd, &ps);
00160                 // TODO: Add any drawing code here...
00161                 EndPaint(hWnd, &ps);
00162                 break;
00163         case WM_DESTROY:
00164                 PostQuitMessage(0);
00165                 break;
00166         default:
00167                 return DefWindowProc(hWnd, message, wParam, lParam);
00168         }
00169         return 0;
00170 }
00171 
00172 // Message handler for about box.
00173 INT_PTR CALLBACK About(HWND hDlg, UINT message, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00174 {
00175         UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER(lParam);
00176         switch (message)
00177         {
00178         case WM_INITDIALOG:
00179                 return (INT_PTR)TRUE;
00180 
00181         case WM_COMMAND:
00182                 if (LOWORD(wParam) == IDOK || LOWORD(wParam) == IDCANCEL)
00183                 {
00184                         EndDialog(hDlg, LOWORD(wParam));
00185                         return (INT_PTR)TRUE;
00186                 }
00187                 break;
00188         }
00189         return (INT_PTR)FALSE;
00190 }
